intro: Geranium haemanthum, commonly known as the "Venus' tears" or "red geranium," is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is a succulent perennial that features fleshy, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive red or purple hue. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens, containers, or as a ground cover. Geranium haemanthum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
